newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Russian banker stabbed to death in Cyprus.
newsitem.headline: Russian banker stabbed to death in Cyprus.

text.p: A Russian banker was stabbed to death in Cyprus after a scuffle with fellow Russians at a dinner party, police said on Friday.
The victim, identified as Seagei Malekhou, 29, was dead on arrival at a hospital in the southern port city of Limassol on Thursday night.
The killing occurred at a dinner party at the house of another Russian in the city's plush Germasoyia suburb.

Police have detained the host, Sergei Akaronov, and another Russian, Sergei Asqerov, for questioning. They launched a manhunt for another four Russians, visitors to Cyprus and believed to be present when Malekhou was stabbed.
Police said Malekhou was the manager of an offshore bank based in Limassol, but could not specify which one.

"He was at the house with other Russians and a scuffle broke out for unknown reasons. During all the fuss one of them apparently pulled out a knife and fatally injured him in the chest," a police spokesman told Reuters.
The people at the party had consumed considerable quantities of alcohol, he added.
The stabbing was witnessed by Malekhou's wife Irina, who fled the scene and telephoned police from a nearby house.
